intro: Sprucella cyrtobotrya, commonly known as the African sprucelace, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its distinctive, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in shades of yellow and white. Sprucella cyrtobotrya is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
